 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָשַׁב‎</span>] **verb** ==blow== (Late Hebrew = Biblical Hebrew; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְשַׁב‎</span> (but also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחַב‎</span>), Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, all ***blow***; \|\| form of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָשַׁף‎</span>); — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָָֽשְׁבָה בּוֺ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רוּחַ י‎</span> [[Isa.40.7|Isa 40:7]] ***the breath of*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> ***has blown upon it***. **Hiph\`il** ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַשֵּׁב רוּחַ‎</span> [[Ps.147.18|Ps 147:18]] ***he causes*** his wind ***to blow***; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּשֵּׁב אֹתָם‎</span> [[Gen.15.11|Gen 15:11]] ***and he drove them away*** (perhaps originally ***blow away***, drive away by blowing, or by a sound like blowing).
